Package edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.graph

Interface Graph<V,​E>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of vertices in the graph
    E - the type of edges in the graph
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGraph, AdjacencyListGraph, AdjacencyMapGraph, AdjacencyMatrixGraph, EdgeListGraph
    public interface Graph<V,​E>
    The Graph abstract data type represents a collection of vertices, edges, and the relationships between vertices and edges. The Graph interface is based on the implementation developed for use with the textbook: Data Structures and Algorithms in Java, Sixth Edition Michael T. Goodrich, Roberto Tamassia, and Michael H. Goldwasser John Wiley and Sons, 2014
    Author:
    Dr. King

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  Graph.Edge<E>
      Represents an Edge in a Graph
      static interface  Graph.Vertex<V>
      Represents a Vertex in a Graph

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.Iterable<Graph.Edge<E>> edges()
      Returns an Iterable collection of edges in the graph
      Graph.Vertex<V>[] endVertices​(Graph.Edge<E> edge)
      Returns an array that represents the two endpoint vertices of the given edge
      Graph.Edge<E> getEdge​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex1, Graph.Vertex<V> vertex2)
      Returns the edge that exists between vertex1 and vertex2; if no edge exists from vertex1 to vertex2, return null
      java.lang.Iterable<Graph.Edge<E>> incomingEdges​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex)
      Returns an Iterable collection of incoming edges for a given vertex
      int inDegree​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex)
      Returns the indegree of the given vertex -- in other words, the number of edges that are 'entering' the given vertex
      Graph.Edge<E> insertEdge​(Graph.Vertex<V> v1, Graph.Vertex<V> v2, E edgeData)
      Adds a new edge to the graph, and returns a reference to the edge that was created
      Graph.Vertex<V> insertVertex​(V vertexData)
      Adds a new vertex to the graph, and returns a reference to the vertex that was created
      boolean isDirected()
      Returns true if the graph is directed; otherwise, return false if the graph is undirected
      int numEdges()
      Returns the number of edges in the graph
      int numVertices()
      Returns the number of vertices in the graph
      Graph.Vertex<V> opposite​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex, Graph.Edge<E> edge)
      Given an edge and one of the edge's endpoint vertices, returns the remaining endpoint vertex
      int outDegree​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex)
      Returns the outdegree of the given vertex -- in other words, the number of edges that are 'leaving' the given vertex
      java.lang.Iterable<Graph.Edge<E>> outgoingEdges​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex)
      Returns an Iterable collection of outgoing edges for a given vertex
      void removeEdge​(Graph.Edge<E> edge)
      Removes the given edge from the graph.
      void removeVertex​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex)
      Removes the given vertex from the graph.
      java.lang.Iterable<Graph.Vertex<V>> vertices()
      Returns an Iterable collection of vertices in the graph

      • getEdge

        Graph.Edge<E> getEdge​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex1,
                      Graph.Vertex<V> vertex2)
        Returns the edge that exists between vertex1 and vertex2; if no edge exists from vertex1 to vertex2, return null
        Parameters:
        vertex1 - an endpoint vertex; for a directed graph, the source vertex
        vertex2 - an endpoint vertex; for a directed graph, the destination vertex
        Returns:
        the edge that exists between vertex1 and vertex2

      • endVertices

        Graph.Vertex<V>[] endVertices​(Graph.Edge<E> edge)
        Returns an array that represents the two endpoint vertices of the given edge
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge for which to retrieve endpoint vertices
        Returns:
        an array that represents the two endpoint vertices of the given edge

      • opposite

        Graph.Vertex<V> opposite​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex,
                         Graph.Edge<E> edge)
        Given an edge and one of the edge's endpoint vertices, returns the remaining endpoint vertex
        Parameters:
        vertex - an endpoint vertex of the given edge
        edge - the edge for which to determine endpoint vertices
        Returns:
        the remaining endpoint vertex for the given edge

      • outDegree

        int outDegree​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex)
        Returns the outdegree of the given vertex -- in other words, the number of edges that are 'leaving' the given vertex
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex for which to retrieve the outdegree
        Returns:
        the outdegree of the given vertex

        int inDegree​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex)
        Returns the indegree of the given vertex -- in other words, the number of edges that are 'entering' the given vertex
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex for which to retrieve the indegree
        Returns:
        the indegree of the given vertex

      • insertVertex

        Graph.Vertex<V> insertVertex​(V vertexData)
        Adds a new vertex to the graph, and returns a reference to the vertex that was created
        Parameters:
        vertexData - the data to store in the new vertex
        Returns:
        a reference to the newly created vertex

      • insertEdge

        Graph.Edge<E> insertEdge​(Graph.Vertex<V> v1,
                         Graph.Vertex<V> v2,
                         E edgeData)
        Adds a new edge to the graph, and returns a reference to the edge that was created
        Parameters:
        v1 - for an undirected graph, one of the endpoint vertices; for a directed graph, the source vertex
        v2 - for an undirected graph, one of the endpoint vertices; for a directed graph, the destination vertex
        edgeData - the data to store in the new edge
        Returns:
        a reference to the newly created edge

      • removeVertex

        void removeVertex​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex)
        Removes the given vertex from the graph. Also removes all of the vertex's incident (incoming and outgoing) edges from the graph.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex to remove from the graph

      • removeEdge

        void removeEdge​(Graph.Edge<E> edge)
        Removes the given edge from the graph.
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge to remove from the graph
